frame.name: Make_possible_to_do
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Enablement</fen> provides the circumstances for an <fen>Enabled_action</fen> to occur.
<ex><fex name="Enablement">Technology</fex> has <t>permitted</t> <fex name="Enabled_action">firms</fex> <fex name="Enabled_action">to link together more closely</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Enablement">Any membrane</fex> <fex name="Enablement">which</fex> will <t>permit</t> <fex name="Enabled_action">the passage of oxygen</fex> will also permit the passage of water .</ex>
<ex>Unlike DOS , <fex name="Enablement">Windows</fex> <t>lets</t> <fex name="Enabled_action">you</fex> <fex name="Enabled_action">get on with something else</fex> <fex name="Time">when sending a fax</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Enablement">Liberalization</fex> <t>allows</t> <fex name="Enabled_action">easier entry into particular markets</fex> .</ex>
<ex><fex name="Enablement">Mesh</fex> <t>allows</t> <fex name="Enabled_action">the water</fex> <fex name="Enabled_action">to circulate normally through the aquarium</fex>.</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Enabled_action
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Enabled_action</fen> is that which depends on the <fen>Enablement</fen> in order to be possible to occur.</def-root>

FE.name: Enablement
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Enablement</fen> is the physcial entity or state of affairs that, through its existence, makes possible the <fen>Enabled_action</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>Time is when the <fen>Enablement</fen> makes the <fen>Enabled_action</fen> possible.
<ex>This contact lens <t>permits</t> a split-brain patient to move her eyes freely <fex name="Time">when examining an object</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>The location where the <fen>Enablement</fen> makes the <fen>Enabled_action</fen> possible.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>The way in which the <fen>Enablement</fen> makes the <fen>Enabled_action</fen> possible.</def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Circumstances</fen> describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. </def-root>
